snippet: Deutsche Bank, the big German lender, said claims made by whistle-blowers that it had hidden $12 billion in losses during the financial crisis had been investigated previously and found to be without merit.
abstract: Deutsche Bank, the big German lender, said claims made by whistle-blowers that it had hidden $12 billion in losses during the financial crisis had been investigated previously and found to be without merit.

headline.main: Deutsche Bank Says Report That It Hid Losses Lacks Merit
